page.title: 12FOLKLORE (contd.)
page.content: They called in a number of the Colonels retainers to help. At about {midnight}Edward blew the dead man's silver wind call, and soon afterwards several riders approached. Edward fired Copenhagen, which was a signal for the other guns to fire, and four robbers were hit. The remainder fled but returned during the night to recover the bodies of their comrades. Although rewards were offered none of the culprits were traced. In {Bellingham churchyard}is a grave stone in the shape of a long pack, but the identity of the body which lies beneath has never been discovered. Near Birtley is the{Devil's Stone, } which stands above the Holy Well. On the stone are hoof marks,said to be made by the Devil when he tried to jump across the river but was drowned in{Leap Crag Pool. }
